scenes.title: What are Adverbs?
scenes.narration_text: Hello friends! Today we're learning about adverbs. Adverbs are special words that tell us more about verbs - they describe HOW, WHEN, or WHERE an action happens. They make our sentences more interesting and clear!
scenes.visual_prompt: Colorful classroom with a friendly teacher pointing to a board showing 'ADVERBS' with three branches labeled 'HOW?', 'WHEN?', 'WHERE?'. Animated action icons around each branch.

scenes.title: Adverbs Tell Us HOW
scenes.narration_text: First, adverbs can tell us HOW something happens. Look at these examples: The rabbit runs quickly. The turtle walks slowly. The bird sings sweetly. The words 'quickly', 'slowly', and 'sweetly' tell us HOW the action is done!
scenes.visual_prompt: Three panels showing: 1) Rabbit running fast with 'QUICKLY' label, 2) Turtle walking with 'SLOWLY' label, 3) Bird singing with 'SWEETLY' label. Each adverb is highlighted in bright colors.

scenes.title: More HOW Adverbs
scenes.narration_text: Here are more adverbs that tell us HOW: She speaks softly. He laughs loudly. They work carefully. The children play happily. Notice how most of these adverbs end with 'ly'? That's a helpful clue!
scenes.visual_prompt: Four scenes with children: 1) Girl whispering 'softly', 2) Boy laughing 'loudly', 3) Students working 'carefully', 4) Kids playing 'happily'. The '-ly' endings are highlighted in each word.

scenes.title: Adverbs Tell Us WHEN
scenes.narration_text: Adverbs can also tell us WHEN something happens. Listen to these: I will go to school tomorrow. We played cricket yesterday. She is studying now. The words 'tomorrow', 'yesterday', and 'now' tell us WHEN the action happens!
scenes.visual_prompt: Timeline showing three points: 'YESTERDAY' (children playing cricket), 'NOW' (girl studying), 'TOMORROW' (boy walking to school). Each time word is clearly labeled.

scenes.title: Adverbs Tell Us WHERE
scenes.narration_text: Finally, adverbs can tell us WHERE something happens. For example: The cat is sleeping outside. Come here, please! The birds fly everywhere. The words 'outside', 'here', and 'everywhere' tell us WHERE the action takes place!
scenes.visual_prompt: Three locations shown: 1) Cat sleeping outside a house labeled 'OUTSIDE', 2) Person pointing to a spot labeled 'HERE', 3) Birds flying in sky labeled 'EVERYWHERE'. Location words emphasized.

scenes.title: You're an Adverb Expert!
scenes.narration_text: Great job! Now you know that adverbs describe verbs by telling us HOW, WHEN, or WHERE. Remember: HOW - quickly, slowly, carefully. WHEN - yesterday, now, tomorrow. WHERE - here, outside, everywhere. Start noticing adverbs in your reading!
scenes.visual_prompt: Summary chart with three colorful sections: 'HOW' (quickly, slowly), 'WHEN' (yesterday, now), 'WHERE' (here, outside). Happy students celebrating with stars and confetti.
